headline.print_headline: A Gifted Talker Is Speaking Out
headline.main: Garagiola, Who Quit, Warns About Chewing Tobacco

docs.lead_paragraph: The former baseball player and broadcaster Joe Garagiola has spoken to Congress, players and others about the hazards of smokeless tobacco.
docs.snippet: The former baseball player and broadcaster Joe Garagiola has spoken to Congress, players and others about the hazards of smokeless tobacco.

docs.abstract: Bucks blog notes survey that finds majority of middle-class Americans say they are healthier because of frugal behavior, often by cooking at home or getting more exercise (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Here's an unlikely effect of recession: It may actually be helping some Americans improve their health. The majority of middle-class Americans say they are healthier because of frugal behaviors during the last year, including cooking at home or spending less on junk food, according to the results of a survey that the financial planning firm First Command Financial Services plans to release this week.
